name: Mac and Cheese
instructions: Cook macaroni until al dente and drain.
In a saucepan, melt butter and whisk in flour.
Gradually add milk, stirring until thickened.
Stir in cheese until melted.
Mix with macaroni and serve.
description: A creamy, cheesy comfort food favorite made with tender elbow macaroni and rich cheddar sauce. Perfect for weeknight dinners or indulgent side dishes.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Sauté onion and garlic, then add ground beef.
Add tomato sauce and simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve sauce over spaghetti.
description: A hearty Italian classic with rich tomato sauce and seasoned ground beef. Served over al dente spaghetti for a satisfying meal.

name: Classic Lasagna
instructions: Boil lasagna noodles and set aside.
Mix ricotta, egg, salt, and pepper.
Layer noodles, ricotta, meat sauce, and mozzarella in a baking dish.
Repeat layers and top with parmesan.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes.
description: Layers of pasta, creamy ricotta, meat sauce, and melted cheese create the ultimate comfort food. Baked to golden perfection for family feasts.

name: Chicken Cordon Bleu
instructions: Pound chicken breasts flat and season.
Place ham and cheese on each breast and roll tightly.
Dip in beaten egg and coat with breadcrumbs.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 30 minutes or until golden.
description: Juicy chicken breasts wrapped around ham and Swiss cheese, then baked until crispy. A gourmet dish perfect for elegant dinners.

name: Binignit
instructions: Boil coconut milk and water in a pot.
Add glutinous rice and cook until soft.
Add sweet potatoes and bananas, cook until tender.
Add sugar, tapioca pearls, and jackfruit.
Simmer until thick and serve warm.
description: A sweet Filipino stew made with coconut milk, root crops, and fruits. Warm and hearty, it's traditionally served during Holy Week.

name: Red Velvet Cake
instructions: Mix dry ingredients together.
In another bowl, combine wet ingredients.
Combine all and pour into a cake pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30–35 minutes.
Cool and frost with cream cheese frosting.
description: A moist and velvety cake with a subtle cocoa flavor and deep red color. Often frosted with tangy cream cheese for a rich finish.

name: Egg Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Beat eggs, add sugar, milk, and vanilla.
Pour into the pie crust.
Bake for 45 minutes or until firm.
Cool before serving.
description: A popular Filipino dessert with a sweet, creamy custard filling in a buttery crust. Best served chilled or slightly warm.

name: Pork Adobo
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a pot.
Marinate for 30 minutes.
Bring to a boil, lower heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Cook until meat is tender and sauce is reduced.
description: A beloved Filipino dish made with pork simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, and spices. Tender, flavorful, and perfect with rice.

name: Lechon Kawali
instructions: Boil pork belly with salt and pepper until tender.
Let it dry completely.
Deep-fry until golden and crispy.
Slice and serve with liver sauce.
description: Crispy fried pork belly that's tender on the inside and golden on the outside. A crunchy Filipino favorite best dipped in liver sauce.

name: Leche Flan
instructions: Melt sugar in a pan over low heat until golden brown. Pour into a llanera or mold and let it harden.
In a bowl, gently whisk egg yolks. Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
Strain the mixture to remove bubbles and pour over the caramel in the mold.
Cover with foil and steam for 30–35 minutes or until set.
Let cool, then refrigerate. To serve, run a knife around the edges and invert onto a plate.
description: A rich, creamy custard topped with golden caramel. This Filipino dessert melts in your mouth and is a must for celebrations.
